markdownContent:
Unexpectedly (or entirely expectedly?), you were accepted for the internship after talking with director Laura. To the question of when you should start, she'd exclaimed, “Right now!”

So, you'd agreed on the coming Monday---and here we are.

You're standing in front of the large building you've already seen on the internet and notice that there are actually two entrances: the main entrance, through which the visitors normally go; and a somewhat hidden side entrance. It's Monday, so the museum is closed to the public. You're not sure which door to try, but there is a threatening-looking, blinking red light next to the main door: you fear that an alarm is active. You could be considered an employee now, so the side entrance would be appropriate. But no one knows you yet, so it's going to be awkward to explain why you just entered the museum without an invitation...
